at.ac.tuwien.ict.andropicar.server.connections

Class CarConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • at.ac.tuwien.ict.andropicar.server.connections.Connection
      • at.ac.tuwien.ict.andropicar.server.connections.CarConnection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class CarConnection
extends Connection
    This class is used to communicate with a car via a TCP-connection (see Connection class for more information on the basic functionalities).
    It holds the reference to the PhoneConnection of a linked phone (if any) in order to be able to forward information such as sensor-data to it.
    This class provides the means for a linked phone to send data (e.g. control-data) to the car.
    Author:
    Boeck

    • Constructor Detail

      • CarConnection

        public CarConnection(java.net.Socket connection,
                     java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingQueue<QueueElement> operationQueue)
        Used to initialize this class with a Socket, this cars ID and a LinkedBlockingQueue for communicating with the main-thread.
        Parameters:
        connection - the Socket for this class. Needs to be pre-configured (priority, read-timeout, etc.), since this class does not provide means to configure the Socket.
        operationQueue - this LinkedBlockingQueue is used to communicate with the main-thread.

    • Method Detail

      • getCarInformation

        public CarInformation getCarInformation()

        the cars informations.

      • setLinkedPhone

        public void setLinkedPhone(PhoneConnection linkedPhone)
        Sets the linked Phone to the given parameter, therefore terminating any link that might already be established.
        If the linkedPhones state is currently not null, it is informed about the termination of the link. If the linkedPhones state is going to be set to null, the car itself is informed about the termination of the link.
        Parameters:
        linkedPhone - the PhoneConnection that linkedPhone should be set to.

      • closeConnection

        protected void closeConnection()
        Tries to gracefully close the connection, set the closeConnection-flag to true and informs the main-thread about this event through the operationQueue.
        Also, the linked phone (if any) is informed about the termination of the link, by setting its linked car to null.
        Overrides:
        closeConnection in class Connection

      • updateListeners

        This method informs all registered listeners about incoming data.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:

      • processSensorData

        private void processSensorData(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> decodedDataset)
        Processes all sensor-related data and puts it into the HashMap that is being forwarded to the linked phone.
        Parameters:
        decodedDataset - the HashMap that contains the message that is to be searched for sensor-data.

      • processCarInformation

        private void processCarInformation(java.util.List<java.lang.String> infos)
        Searches through a list of Strings and updates carInfo, if it contains certain keywords.
        Parameters:
        infos - the list of String to be searched through.

      • register

        protected java.lang.Long register()
        Description copied from class: Connection
        This method waits until the connected device has sent identification information. It also requests identification every 5 seconds that no identification information has been received. While waiting for identification of the connected device, all other received information is discarded.
        If identification has been received, the main-thread is informed about the event. In this case, the connected device must not yet be informed about the success of the operation. This is handled by the main-thread in order to be able to conform with the Servers whitelist.
        Overrides:
        register in class Connection
        Returns:
        the received id

      • run

        public void run()
